title: Just revert Akali
body:
As much as I love the rework, I always knew it was going to be an unbalanceable piece of shit. I mean, that's just the CertainlyT special, give a champion 10 million different ways of handling a situation with little to no downsides. 

At least with old Akali her kit was balanceable, as in you could just tweak her numbers and she would go back to being at least somewhat balanced again. You tweak ANYTHING with a CertainlyT flavor to it and suddenly the champion is either sitting at 36% win rate or a 54% win rate, or in Akali's case, completely and utterly disgusting in professional play as she's a "safe" assassin who plays more akin to a diving bruiser with escapes...who always gets in the low 40s and 30s in terms of win rate % when she's ever nerfed.

We've all seen the circus level changes on the PBE, so let's just get old Akali back and go from there, at least until Riot can _actually_ design a proper rework for her that doesn't involve her having 6 forms of self-peel, 6 forms of chasing your ass across the entire lane and like 10 separate instances of damage; because for some reason giving an assassin a spammable auto passive was a good idea.

Again, I for one love the rework, it actually made me play Akali more to the point where she's now my secondary...but even I can admit that this rework will never be fair and it's gotta go.

Y'all need to stop looking at old Akali through rose-colored glasses. As bad as new one is, old one was a hundred times worse. First of all, she had 100% of her damage as point-and-click. On an assassin, a class designed to kill fast, having no way to outplay their damaging abilities is a huge problem by itself. And then she also had built-in sustain. On top of that, a 3-charge dash which also refunded charges on takedown. This all led to her being stat check personified: if she had enough numbers she'd jump on someone, murder them with zero counterplay while healing to full and proceed to repeat on closest still living enemy champion. If she didn't have enough numbers her team was playing 4v5 as she brought literally nothing at that point.

Balanceable? Not by a long shot. Old Akali was either completely oppressive or dumpster tier with no middle ground. Better to continue working on new version for as long as needed than bring that abomination back in any form.

By the way, you say old Akali had no counterplay, but what about ADCs? What about mages who still have targeted abilities? What about supports who still have targeted abilities?

Let's not forget about all of those then. If old Akali and the like have to go then so do all targeted spells as they lack counterplay.

Most adcs and point and click mages i.e ({{champion:69}}  can't inta-kill you unless they're MASSIVELY far ahead. Unlike pre-rework {{champion:84}}. 

Also, you can itemize against an ADC or a DPS mage. {{item:3143}} for ADCs and {{item:3194}} for DPS mages.

No such luck vs old {{champion:84}}. You build to deal with her one-shot power? She drain tanks your ass. Build offensive to avoid drain tanking? She one-shots you.

>Y'all need to stop looking at old Akali through rose-colored glasses

I'm not, statistically, she was balanced from late 2015 to early 2017. Those aren't rose-tinted glasses I'm wearing, those are literal stats I'm looking at. Her highest (consistent) win rate was 53%, and her lowest at the time was 47%, and she had like a 1%-2% pick rate. That's balanced.

This Akali has a ~47% win rate and between 4%-8% in terms of pick rate, and a 100% Pick/Ban presence in professional play (that might've changed over the last month?). That's not balanced.

> As bad as new one is, old one was a hundred times worse. First of all, she had 100% of her damage as point-and-click. On an assassin, a class designed to kill fast, having no way to outplay their damaging abilities is a huge problem by itself.

Great, and now here we are with a champion that's practically the same just with more flexibility. 

Also, point and click damage is hardly an issue. If anything it's a downside as you lack range.

> And then she also had built-in sustain

Mmm, that's true, but it was a reasonable amount (before they buffed her passive to have a 4 sec cooldown for some reason).

>On top of that, a 3-charge dash which also refunded charges on takedown. This all led to her being stat check personified: if she had enough numbers she'd jump on someone, murder them with zero counterplay while healing to full and proceed to repeat on closest still living enemy champion.

Actually there was plenty of counterplay. You could displace/CC her during her dash and kill her, place down a pink ward and murder her, not fight her because her ult had a low(ish) range and you could just y'know; not 1v1 her.

As for the latter part, so the healing part...just remove {{item:3146}} . It's an abomination of an item that has no place in the game anymore.

>Balanceable? Not by a long shot. Old Akali was either completely oppressive or dumpster tier with no middle ground.

Ok, but statistically this version of Akali is far harder to balance than pre-rework Akali or Akali 1.5. How do you explain that?

Pre-rework Akali had hardly any changes made to her and she did just fine, and she was actually easy to nerf. 
This Akali on the other hand, receives only nerf...after nerf...after nerf...after nerf...after removal of a certain new aspect of her kit...after nerf.

-------------------------------

Look, I did say that the revert would likely only be temporary. At least until they can design a rework that isn't literal aids to face, as tbh Akali 1.5 is the lesser of these two evils.

As I've stated, the problem of her damage being point and click was amplified by the fact that she's an assassin, a class that traditionally deals heavy burst damage. ADCs deal sustained damage, meaning there is a time window between an ADC engaging you and you dying. Mages don't have their entire kits being PnC, and support damage falls off a cliff. If Sona Q+AAs you after early game it tickles. If old Akali did it you died. That's a pretty big difference.

> Mmm, that's true, but it was a reasonable amount (before they buffed her passive to have a 4 sec cooldown for some reason).

"CC and kill" is a counterplay to any champion. PInk warding, again, relied on Akali not having numbers to do her task. If she did, congratulations! You can see her while she's murdering you! On the other hand, if she didn't have numbers then warding was just a waste. Hardly a satisfying outcome for anyone.

> As for the latter part, so the healing part...just remove {{item:3146}} . It's an abomination of an item that has no place in the game anymore.

Agreed on that. Remove {{item:3812}} as well while on it.

> Ok, but statistically this version of Akali is far harder to balance than pre-rework Akali or Akali 1.5. How do you explain that?

That's easily explained with her skill requirement. New Akali is one of most difficult champions to master, meaning she can never be balanced for anyone. In hands of good players with coordinated teams she will dominate, so she needs to be kept in a gutter for everyone else. Compared to old Akali, who was extremely easy to pick up and as such her winrate difference between bad and good players was lower.

> Pre-rework Akali had hardly any changes made to her and she did just fine, and she was actually easy to nerf. 
> This Akali on the other hand, receives only nerf...after nerf...after nerf...after nerf...after removal of a certain new aspect of her kit...after nerf.

While she was "easy to nerf", she wasn't fine at all game-health wise. As with new Akali, when old Akali was strong she sucked the fun out for everyone due to how easily she could get out of control and how hard it was to stop her once that happened.

Considering she got full model update as well, with animations and particles to fit her new abilities, that isn't happening. But it's still debatable which one is a lesser evil.

I agree with most of what you're saying, except when you say {{champion:23}} is balanced; which he certainly is not.  Also point and click damage/CC IS a huge problem even excluding burst, so either have it all or have none of it. 

I suppose I didn't word my post correctly, I just want her reverted until they can design a kit that isn't as nerfed as this one. She needs another rework, just like Mord and Kat; or at least a mini-rework.

To be honest the biggest problem with Akali IMO is the same as it is with League as a whole: rampant damage creep. In theory, Akali is very fair for an assasin. She has high energy costs, low damage for spending energy and passive which encourages weaving in and out of combat to maximize her effecticeness. Also limited mobility compared to other assassins, relying on shroud and trickery to escape.

In practice she kills you in one combo just like anyone else does due to how powerful runes and items are and how much defense sucks. So she's left with true assassin level burst while also having all the tools of a skirmisher.
